snippet: Command Sgt. Maj. Teresa L. King, recently reinstated as head of an elite drill sergeant school, says her male supervisors tried to undermine her authority because she is a woman.
abstract: Command Sgt Maj Teresa L King has been reinstated as commandant of the Army's elite drill sergeant school at Fort Jackson, SC, after asserting that her male supervisors had mistreated her due to her gender; King had been celebrated as the first woman to be appointed to the role, but her superiors eventually suspended her, alleging that she maintained rigid and unfair standards.
lead_paragraph: Command Sgt. Maj. Teresa L. King, recently reinstated as head of an elite drill sergeant school, says her male supervisors tried to undermine her authority because she is a woman.
